articles.description: Follow live radio commentary and text updates from the Rugby World Cup as Ireland play Tonga in Nantes.
articles.title: Rugby World Cup: Ireland v Tonga - radio & text

articles.description: A much-changed Wales struggle to a bonus-point World Cup victory over impressive Portugal in Nice.
articles.title: Wales struggle to beat impressive Portugal

articles.description: Follow live BBC Three coverage from the Diamond League final in Eugene as Americans Noah Lyles and Sha’Carri Richardson compete in the men's and women's100m finals and Great Britain's Laura Muir in the women's 1500m.
articles.title: Watch: Diamond League finals - Richardson, Lyles & GB's Muir in action

articles.description: Follow live text and score updates as Barcelona host Real Betis at the Nou Camp looking to move top of La Liga.
articles.title: La Liga: Barcelona host Real Betis - follow live

articles.description: Brighton cruised past Manchester United at Old Trafford to hand the Reds their third defeat of the season
articles.title: Brighton up to third with 3-1 win over Man Utd

articles.description: Man Utd head coach Erik ten Hag says "individuals have to step up" after his side's 3-1 Premier League defeat to Brighton at Old Trafford.
articles.title: 'Individuals have to step up' - Ten Hag on Brighton loss

articles.description: Ferrari's Carlos Sainz edges out George Russell's Mercedes for pole position as Max Verstappen qualifies 11th at the Singapore Grand Prix.
articles.title: Sainz on Singapore pole as angry Verstappen struggles

articles.description: Callum Wilson scores from the penalty spot as Newcastle beat Brentford at St James' Park to ease the pressure on manager Eddie Howe.
articles.title: Newcastle beat Brentford to ease pressure on Howe

articles.description: Harry Swindells hits an unbeaten century before Leicestershire beat Hampshire off the last ball to win the One-Day Cup at Trent Bridge.
articles.title: Foxes beat Hants to win cup in last-ball thriller

articles.description: Celtic move two points clear at the top of the Scottish Premiership after eventually overwhelming stubborn visitors Dundee.
articles.title: Leaders Celtic ease to victory over stubborn Dundee
